review: This is Mile High mud pie at Red Robin's in South Plainfield. This is a delicious big portion of mud pie with caramel drizzle on it. It was delicious. The only issue I had with it is that my tube grand niece and nephews came over and devoured it and left me hardly any. The cookie crumb crust was really good. even though I've had better desserts at different places this is a must-have.

They should just go out of business at this point. I have had three bad experiences at the South Plainfield Red Robin with the food being inedible. Burned to a crisp. Not what I asked for and I am far from picky. My food was burned so bad I couldn't even eat it. I dissected it just for fun instead.  I mean does this look like a medium burger to you? Should we talk about the burned cheese fries? Or nah? I mean really? Even the bun is burned. Nothing about this has been a good experience, except the staff being nice. It used to be one of my favorite places. Now it is a place to avoid. HORRIBLE food. The staff is super friendly & always work hard. Maybe if they were paid a liveable wage, (so typical of large chain establishments), the food would be better.  Two thumbs down for the South Plainfield Red Robin. Three strikes and you're out

Went here yesterday with my burgeoned for dinner. I had the Banzi burger and a 22oz Blue Moon.  Please do the same you will not regret it. They could have given some more fries, but it's ok.. the burger itself was very filling and I didn't need to get more. I highly recommend and will be back soon

Got Red Robin's take out. Ordered and paid for Garlic fries with extra garlic seasoning. And ordered garlic on the side. Got home and had regular fries. Guess I need to start checking my take out ordered. Second time this has happened The teriyaki chicken was very good. And the lady behind the bar for take out was friendly.

The Manager is a rude douche bag. He was speaking down to an employee in front of customers, telling her how to pour a beer, like that's rocket science. I mentioned to my friend that he was wrong and the manager whipped around and verbally attacked me in a confrontational manor. He kept on and wouldn't let it go until I turned my back to him. The rest of the staff was nice. He needs to be taught how to be a REAL manager or maybe he needs to be replaced with a REAL manager. The choice is yours Red Robin.

What a difference seven years makes, although I've been back here sporadically between my initial review and this updated one. Last night's visit proved to be a dining debacle of epic proportions. Our 15-minute wait after giving our name to the hostess confirmed a sad fact: understaffed and ill-prepared for the holiday shopping dinner onslaught, confirmed by all the empty tables when we were seated. Burgers were dry, overdressed and falling apart, and for a burger that has a starting price tag of roughly $9, unacceptable. Our full view into the kitchen where we were seated showed a filthy mess of overflowing garbage and debris all over the floor. The capper was an erroneous charge on the bill for something we didn't have, which due to the fact that they were understaffed, added an additional 20 minutes to our "experience" until it was finally rectified. Shame...I used to love their burgers. I'll just need to go to Shake Shack from now on and sneak my own booze in ;^)

Well we thought we would stop in for lunch , last time we were here was years ago since we thought the food was trouble . We gave another shoot it was ok because of two factors the price and the staff . Burgers were nothing special or gourmet about them a standard burger patties. The garlic fries were ok nothing wow about them . Onion rings were spot on pleasure to eat .

Was just in the non existent central Jersey area to visit a friend and we decided to stop by this Red Robin to grab a bite. At first we were skeptical but this really nice hostess named Jenny or Jamie? I forgot got us a table as soon as possible. She recommended the bottomless fries and my friend and I got milkshakes to match. The service was impeccable and the food was given to us very quickly. This however may be due to it being a Sunday but I'll take it. Never thought I'd say I'll come back to a Red Robin but I just might with this one!

The only reason i went the this place is because they introduced their new salmon ( Harissa) burger . I am not gonna get to the long story here , I am from Morocco I know what (Harissa) looks , and taste like . Hellas , that burger was far from what I expected , instead of Harissa , the put some seasoning paprika powder !! Crazy right ?  Please don't lie to people , it's despicable.
Food is good but their service is sooooo slow!! I love how you can customize any burger to make it vegetarian friendly.

The food here was good. I enjoyed my banzai burger, and the side of broccoli was cooked perfectly. But the good taste does not justify the HUGE PLASTIC CONTAINERS they give you for takeout orders. The red plastic box containing my burger was the biggest container I'd ever seen, easily enough to fit a layer cake. Within it was a smaller plastic container with my broccoli inside. The amount of plastic used prevented me from enjoying my lunch. Please take a cue from Panera or Chipotle and use sensible, recyclable packaging. Then I'll be happy to order all the time.

I would have honestly given this place a -0 but the twitchy waiter I had, I forgot his name like Will or bill or something made the experience great. He was kind and made sure everything was okay. I like him and he should be the manager, because the manager just looked confused and this smeagle looking kid saved the day.

I am SO impressed by Red Robin's new feature of providing each table with a tablet! You can place an order off the online menu (includes pictures), request your server, play games, AND pay your bill. At chains like Red Robin,  I always find myself waiting around to place an additional order or to get my waiter to bring my check... So this feature is a dream come true!! You can even split your bill based on specific items right on the tablet, which is great for large parties.  I ordered a Banzai Burger and subbed the classic steak fries for the garlic herb fries (an extra .99). I've ordered a Banzai Burger at other Red Robin locations and I liked it better elsewhere. My burger was slightly overcooked and could have used more teriyaki sauce. However, I definitely recommend the Banzai Burger if you're dining at Red Robin. Your life will be changed after trying pineapple on your burger! The garlic herb fries weren't amazing, BUT the extra flavor was definitely worth the money. The location was super clean, and as always.. I love the Red Robin décor!  My boyfriend and I only paid about $25 for two burgers AND bottomless garlic herb fries. This is the perfect spot for a cheap date night. We'll definitely be back!

The food is awesome. I have found a new burger place and I'm surprised that I did not find out about this place sooner. My burger was juicy, made to perfection, and was the perfect size. Not too big that you have to take it home, but not too small where you still feel hungry afterwards. Plus, endless fries!! And their fries were amazing. Crispy, fried, golden perfect.  The waiter was a little sassy, but it's okay. He was fun. My friend ordered a milk shake and they forgot to give it to him, but besides that, none of the orders were messed up. There menu is huge with so many options that you can customize. You know, it's your average burger joint, but the burgers are really delicious. Will definitely go back.

First time I was served a burger that was red and frozen in the middle, which was surprising since it was incredibly thin. I never would have returned if not for coworkers taking me there. One ordered a fancy limited time burger that was so bad he only ate a bite. He was annoyed they didn't ask him what was wrong with it. Mine was just meh. I'd actually rather eat at burger king, and there is a Five Guys within walking distance from this place.

Went here today for the first time in a while and I was pleasantly reminded as to why I always loved this place!  They have this new system where you can call your waiter over or order more drinks through a screen on your table, which I'm assuming definitely comes in handy during busy nights. It was pretty quiet tonight so my family and I didn't have to use it for that but it was great for paying when we were all finished, and the receipt even prints out the bottom right in front of you! Fast and easy so I liked it a lot.  Anywho, for appetizers I got a cup of the chicken tortilla soup and it was DELICIOUS. Nice and warm, and had so much flavor. Usually when I get this at restaurants it's too salty but this one was great. I wish I had ordered more. We also got the smaller onion ring tower, which comes with 6 large pieces and is great to share amongst two or three people. The dipping sauces are awesome. My dad got some southwest wrap and he said he liked it a lot but I didn't try it. I did try my mom's bruschetta chicken sandwich on ciabatta, which had a lot of flavor in just the one bite I took of it. I ordered their new southwest sombrero salad which was pretty good. They actually forgot to add my dressing at first so it was a tad dry but when I ordered a side of it, I enjoyed it quite a bit. The fried jalapeño pieces mixed in to the salad added a nice touch.  Had a great experience. Can't go wrong here!

We're there at dinner time so it was busy but that's fine. Our waitress (Hailey) was super nice and knowledgeable. She stayed on top of our drinks. Good came out really fast and fresh. Even though there was a mistake with my fries (I ordered sweet potato and they brought out steak fries), they fixed the mistake with absolutely no headache at all. She showed us the suggestions to entertain the 3 year old we were dining with. The location had chalk boards on the wall that you can take to your table and draw on. Hailey took the time to teach us how to use the pay machine on the table which was a super fast way to pay. We will definitely be dining there again and I hope Hailey is there when we do.

It was a decent experience. My girlfriend and I went to order food. The waitress was courteous, seated us and took our orders quickly. The only hiccup was that I ordered some ginger ale and it came super later, after I was half way through my food. But other than that the service was good.
Really great service. The server and manager went out of the way to ensure we were comfortable and the food was just great. Will definitely visit again
Not a big fan of burgers, but I do like Red Robin. I also like the amount of choices they have for those of us who don't care for red meat.

Awful service.  Food makes me sick afterwards.  Only burgers on the menu really.  The only saving grace is the milkshakes.  Do NOT eat the pretzels.  They're pretty gross. I tried 3 times, not the place for me.

What a nightmare! Just went there tonight with my son.  First the good: - As this was our first time in a Red Robin, we liked to decoration. Very lively and upbeat - Hostess was friendly and had a welcoming smile - Waiter greeted us pretty quickly, taking our drink order, Our drinks arrived quickly - They offer a lot of healthier options such as wrapping your burger in a lettuce wrap instead of a bun and getting a salad or unlimited broccoli instead of fries - Salad was good and the balsamic dressing was good Now the bad - Everything in this place is about upselling you. Even the tablet on your table is about upselling - Very slow to take the order - My main complaint is that the food was terrible. I ordered a burger wrapped in lettuce. First it came out with a bun instead of wrapped in lettuce. They quickly fixed this but the toppings were all incorrect.  - My burger was cold.  I am not exaggerating.  I am not talking lukewarm.  I am talking cold.  - Even though my son ordered the unlimited broccoli, not once did they offer to refill it - In all, the burgers were nothing special at all.  We actually felt that we could have gotten the same as McD's for a lot less money - Service was minimal - This will be our last time at a Red Robin. It is a shame as we were hopeful that this place would have been really good

As I'm typing this, I'm waiting on a first order of "Bottomless Fries." The promotion should read, "Bottomless Fries with a 20 minute wait. And then another 15." I'm honestly impressed with the inefficiency of service on the one selling point of this restaurant. Like, I came here ONLY with the intention of eating my fill of fries. And you'd think that a burgers-and-fries joint would be competent enough to have that fryer running full-blast. Unfortunately, not so. Why am I here? What is life? To its credit, Red Robin has me contemplating the very meaning of existence, what with all the free time its given me. Then again, time is an imaginary construct.

The GM really went out of his way to ensure that me and my spouse had a successful visit. It's not often that you find such a commitment to customer service. We still come here from time to time, and the burgers are usually what you'd expect- tasty. I would still caution that you come at non-peak times. I'm not sure they'll get you out during your lunch break.

DO NOT TOUCH THE IPADS ON THE TABLE. Red Robin is clearly hurting for cash and is competing with neighbor, Corner Bakery Cafe (see my review) for ripping people off. You so much as touch that IPad and you will buy the entire amazon gaming catalog. I think that I have a mortgage now because I touched the IPad. Waitress was nice though and refunded but apparently still needed it to pay. Also, you have to use it to call the waitress? Back in my day, as I was teaching at Rutgers, I used to slap the behinds of my students to get their attention. Today, the world is so PC but back to the food!   Mac and Cheese: Disappointing. Dry and crusty on top and lacking in cheese all over. Most forgettable dish and I have alzheimer's. Seriously, I gave three students D's for their grade because I forgot what their project was about but the great part is, my department dean was like "Screw 'em." God, I love Rutgers. :) Broccoli: When you're as old as I am and have fought in the Civil War (Go Confederacy!), you need your broccoli to fight in the next Civil War 2.0. Broccoli on point. Go Red Robin! :) Fish Fillet Sandwich: It was very large and somewhat acceptable for my Korean War standards. I used to fish to survive, back in my war days. I had three bullets in my leg but my desire to get back to Rutgers and teach was the only things keeping me going. This sandwich really hit my nostalgia spot. If one of my students asks me what I would recommend at Red Robin, I would probably not answer them because there is a high probability that i took the day off (when I have like 200 days off a year- Go Tenure!) But if I was in class, I would tell him Broccoli and Fish Sandwich! :)

The burgers are delicious.....don't look at the nutritional tables though.....just eat your burger / fries and move on. I got the Royal Red Robin there a few weeks ago....and it was up there with one of the better burgers I've had. I wasn't a big fan of the chicken wings....not that they tasted bad but I like them more crispy....a preference item.  Beers were very cold and the wait staff was very attentive but not omnipresent.

I come here bcuz i know can get diff style burgers.  this specific location is not very clean I've noticed the 3 times I've been here. I really dnt know why but the floors especially are never clean. another time I came in, no tables were clear. also I seems that the tables are not wiped off great. anyway...todAy we had kaitlyn and she was very pleasant. she smiled and was attentive the entire visit. fries were hot, broccoli was fresh and burgers were good! no complaints on the food today. I will make sure to let managee know about kaitlyn and also the lack of cleanliness in the dining room.

According to other reviews, I'm not sure if it was just certain wait staff who were bad.. Each time I've been here I had a good experience. Wait staff was mediocre at best - nothing over the top, nothing terrible. Burgers are great (although pretty messy when they came out), fries are alright, milkshakes are good, prices are reasonable. If the wait staff is really so bad that you can't stand it, there's a Chipotle and Red Lobster in the plaza right next door!

When they first opened 5yrs ago it was a good addition to the neighborhood.  There were some kinks in the service but they were new and we kept going back.  Over the past few years the menu has changed and the prices have nearly doubled.  And while their burgers still come with bottomless fries, the introduction (a few years ago) of the silver ring to hold the fries cut the original fry serving that comes with your burger in half.   So the $6-$7 burger that is now $10-$15 comes with less and the service is now being replaced with Electronic Tablets at the table.  Not to mention they don't put silverware or napkins at the table (last 5 visits its been the same this is not isolated) so you usually get your food and then have to catch a bus boy or someone to get forks and napkins which they will slap on your table in a pile and you can hand them out yourself. So now Red Robin wants you to place your own order, flag someone down for the essential napkins and cutlery, if you have any leftovers you will again have to flag someone down and box it up yourself, then you check out with your credit card and if you're lucky enough to even catch the name of the person that delivered your food, you're encouraged to tip 20% when you finalize your bill using the touch pad. Let's review that - you are placing your own order, there is no napkins or silverware on your table or delivered with your food, you are boxing up your own leftovers, then you are closing your order when you finish eating.  What is the wait staff doing?  And are they still only being paid waiters wages?   After swiping your credit card, there is a tip screen with a slider that defaults to 20% of the total bill.  That's 20% of the bill after tax not before tax. Seriously?  I am very generous tipper and I eat out all the time.  But what Red Robin is essentially doing is removing any personal service that you would receive when you go to a restaurant, charging a generous amount for the food and then expecting you to leave a gratuity for the service that they removed?  FAIL You got my last $100 meal for onion rings, burger with fries and softdrinks.  Call me stupid for hanging in this long but the next time the kids ask to go to red robin we'll go somewhere else.
I have been here several times since it first opened, at different times of the day. Their food is consistent and the prices are reasonable.

Another chain restaurant that features slow, inexperienced staff ,small portions of overpriced average tasting food.Took my family here for the first time last week and has to wait 20 minutes just for a table.What a joke!Never again!!!
2 words burning love... umm ummm good.

This RR is a joke as many of the other reviews have stated! The service is horrible. I had to wait 30 minutes for a burger that was done incorrectly. The waitress who waited on me was rude and incompetent. When I called to speak to a manager named Mike he too was pathetic and ignorant. Stay clear away from this RR. They don't deserve your money or time! You have been warned!

I stop by red robin often because they actually have quite a few vegan options. The last time i went in i wasnt sure which sauces were vegan and although the server didnt have a clue the manager went out of her way to look it up and print out all the options available for me!! That was incredible! Thank you so much! We will be back!

Service sucks!! They never have enough people working in the kitchen or serving. I have been there a few times and each time its the same situation... 2 people in the kitchen and only 4 servers! If you do finally get a table and a server... be prepared for the SLOWEST service!!  Management needs to fix this!
Their burgers never disappoint! The Burning love burger is my all time favorite. Nice happy hour specials too!

Food was decent.  We shared an onion ring tower and I had the California grilled chicken sandwich which came out the way I asked - no mayo and sweet potato fries.  Hubby had a burger with bacon and mushrooms.  He didn't care for the mushrooms as they were very garlicky and overpowered the burger.  Service was ok.  The manager did take the appetizer off the bill after we complained after asking the waitress a few times to turn down the air blowing on us.

Red Robin is the shiiiiiet. Been here a lot of times already! I was recently here on Sunday and I've always had a great experience. Our waiter was very helpful and attentive!  I always get the Classic Chocolate Milkshake! YUMMMY! This time around I tried their new Prime Chophouse Burger. Its layered with Horseradish-Sauteed Mushrooms, Gourmet Steak Sauce, Provolone Cheese and Crispy Onion Straws! Stacked on an Onion Bun with creamy Country Dijon Sauce. Holy Crap! I loved this burger. It was really delicious. That Onion bun was so good. The horseradish mushrooms were awesome and that steak sauce was yummy! My first bite was heavenly! It is probably my favorite burger now!  My GF got a regular cheeseburger (boooooring). She also had aFreckled Lemonade, it was a little too sweet for me but was really good! Remember those fries are bottomless! Sweet potato fries were good too! Awesome burger place! I would pick this place over other burger joints such as five guys or 25 burgers!

Shockingly good: bar wings (with hot sauce)...side of yukon chips, not-so-much. Recommend: Red's Tavern Double Burger (classic) & Whiskey River BBQ Chicken Burger (sweet) flaw: not-so-bottomless fries

Our go-to place. Love the burgers, love the prices. We hosted a birthday party there for 20+ people. Although our server seemed like it was her first day, she was our own dedicated waitress and had assistance from other staff members.

I must say, massive improvement at this location. I figure I give them another try after management had a prompt and courteous reply to my past review. They promised me service will be better next time I visited.  They were definitely right.  Came here during lunch and needed to fulfill my burger craving. Ordered the PrimeChopHouse with Salad. For an appetizer we ordered a onion tower. Our server got us our drinks in a minute or two. Very quick. Next our server took our order and brought out our silverware.  What I appreciate though was the speed at which the onion tower coming out. Only 5 minutes. Many times, servers get lazy when the restaurant is not busy and slack off. Not this time. Our food came out like it was 7pm on a busy Saturday night.  Food came out hot and fresh. Our server did a great job of keeping our drinks full.  Awesome improvements Red Robin!! Keep it up. I'll be back when that powerful burger craving creeps up again.
Great burger... I like the lettuce wrap option. They also had so more sweet potato fries. Yum.

Unlike the Woodbridge Red Robin, my burger was cooked to perfection! I asked for it medium well and it was JUST THAT! Bacon was crisp, as was the lettuce with a juicy tomato to compliment it! Service was extremely friendly and this visit has totally restored my faith in this franchise!! Will definitely be returning

Red Robin is one of those classic chain restaurants by I find it a tad homier than some of the other chain restaurants. I have been to Red Robin multiple times and make an effort to try something new every time.  FOOD : Something that I've only seen at Red Robin is a ramen burger. I had very high hopes for this burger after seeing it posted so much on social media and having it advertised so much. Sadly, this was very disappointing for me. The burger itself was too salty and weirdly seasoned and ramen did not act as a good burger bun as everything fell apart as soon as you picked it up. It was worth the try, but not my cup of tea. However, all the other burgers at Red Robin are delicious. I would recommend any of their gourmet burgers! Plus, the fries there are the best. PRICE : Very average for a dinner. About $10 a burger.  ATMOSPHERE : It's a family friendly place as well as a good hangout for the older audience. SERVICE : I have always found the staff at Red Robin to be very pleasant. I've never had a bad  experience. Red Robin also has a new system where you have tablet that you can order some food and ask for attention from a waiter. You also pay on this machine if it's by credit card and it makes splitting checks very easy.

I came here for dinner with my gf who had a gift card that was credited to her as a result of previously poor service. I believe in 2nd food chances and I really like burgers from Red Robin so I was hopeful that our local iteration could redeem itself. If they could even be half as good as the fantastic Hershey, Penna Red Robin, I would have been pleased.  After eating here yesterday, I'm shocked that this particular Red Robin is still in business.  The first issue I had with this Red Robin smacked me right in the face when I walked in. There wasn't a hostess. We were milling around for 5 mins before someone came out and offered us a table. There were plenty of servers and even the manager was there. It was Sunday ~6pm. There is no reason to have the front of the place totally unmanned.  Then I sit down in a greasy sticky table. There were plenty of open seats. I don't know why the hostess decided I needed to sit in the dirty booth.  Our waitress came over and took our drink order and our food order without a hitch. Unfortunately after that,  things really went off the rails. I checked in to Red Robin as soon as I got seated. I took a screen shot of my check in while I was sitting there, without food 45 minutes later. It took over an hour for the waitress to come back and tell us that our food would be out shortly.  Eventually the food came out, delivered by another staff member. This is fine but the waitress should really come over and check on us when the food comes out. My fries were cold. Maybe they were waiting over an hour for my cheeseburger as well.  Also, I ordered my burger well done. If my burger were a new born it would have been a girl, because it was pink! Is it really that hard to cook and serve burgers and fries? Red Robin isn't a place that I'm accustomed to waiting a long time for food to come out. The entire menu is burgers and fries.  There is no earthly reason there should be over an hour wait sitting for food at your table.  The icing on the cake was that our waitress didn't check on us until I finished my food. No refills at all. What a shame, since Red Robin can be great if it is run by someone who knows how to run a restaurant.  Luckily there are plenty of other better burger options virtually right next door. Smashburger and Five guys are better tasting, cheaper, and faster and both down the street. If you want a sit down burger with a drink, I would go to Brick House around the corner EVERY time over this particular Red Robin.

I like the environment however, the food is not really that good. I ordered a cup of French I onion soup and it was very bland. There was no ch see melted over the top and mushrooms were in the soup. I also had a chicken teriyaki wrap. The chicken was chewy and gooey.

We waited a long time for our burgers cooked medium and a turkey burger. Both came out over cooked. Regular burger well done and turkey burger burnt and dry. The waitress said that they were under staffed to explain the long wait and as far as the turkey burger she said that it is normal, all their turkey burgers come out like that because they have to make sure that it's cooked all the way through. Really? Manager came over and admitted turkey burger was "overcooked" and at this point my appetite was gone so i did not order anything to replace my meal. Garlic fries was good, though. Staff education is key! P.S. asked for drinks to go waitress brought back empty cup and half filled cup with left over drinks. Manager took care of everything. Still left a tip though..never sure where things fall apart.

Red Robin is a hidden gem.  Everything in this S.Plainfield location feels updated.  They have these fancy point-of-sales screens at your table so you can order food, call the server, or even pay/split the bill. Everything on the menu is really updated as well.  Heck they even have a ramen burger and a croissant donut tower.  Seriously hats off to corporate for really staying in touch with the times and being creative with the menu. Execution of all their food is good.  No sloppiness from the kitchen.  Servers are attentive and friendly.  Managers are always present and visible. The one thing I don't like is that this location is literally right next to the LA fitness gym that I go to so I have serious guilt issues to deal with when I eat my burger.
Food was good, I got the wedge burger with black beans. Staff was nice and talkative which was good. I would go back here

The only thing you know about Red Robin is their bottomless fries. Burger is not really your thing cause it's too greasy neither are fries. Only reason you go to chain restaurants is because your party is too big for a regular normal restaurant. And you don't want to be a party pooper so you tag along. If you answer YES to the above statements, please proceed ahead- To be quite honest- I'm really not a big fan of burgers and fries- maybe it's because I had a bad food poisoning experience at a burger joint a couple of years back but I think it's mainly because my tummy have PTS and can't handle things that are too greasy (PTS- Princess Tummy Syndrome) so when my church decided to head over to Red Robin for lunch, I so wanted to say NO I'm not going (again PTS kicked in hard) but in the end I decided to join. Really the only thing I know about Red Robin is for their fries and I never though too much about their burgers until this visit in NJ. ( I usually go to the one in Westbury) Our group of about 25 people came on a Sunday afternoon at around 2:00pm and since we had a large party, we waited for about 40 mins to get seated. Decor and Ambiance: very similar to the other Red Robins, sports bar style, you see LCD tv everywhere in the restaurant, there's a big bar right in the front along with some arcade machines for the kids.  Restaurant is filled with many sport memorabilia and pictures of famous sports players.  Very casual and loud but nothing crazy that you can't hear the person next to you. However, cleanness is questionable as the floor was a bit sticky and the bathroom definitely needed some cleaning.  Restaurant seating are mostly booth with some high tables by the sports bar.  Very spacious and the place can easily accommodate 100+ people.  I think Red Robin really upped their game since my last visit because I do not remember seeing so many gourmet burgers the last time I was around.  There are so many choices on the menu that I don't know where to start. Actually I do know since I'm such a big egg head, the one burger that caught my attention right away is the Royal Red Robin (BLT cheeseburger with an egg on top), who wouldn't like that??  There were so many options to choose from but in the end, my favorites are: Towering Onion Rings- Served with Campfire sauce and ranch dressing. Onion Rings are really nothing extraordinary but these are GOOD, FRESHLY GOOD! Definitely made to order because I burnt my lips biting into one of these things! They are crispy and crunchy on the outside and onion is soft on the inside (unlike some places where their onion is still hard and un-chewable), fried to golden brown and the campfire sauce (kinda taste like chipotle sauce) was a great compliment to the onion rings.  The presentation reminded us why we don't play ring toss with our food (had a few onion rings causalities)  Royal Red Robin- Of course I have to go there, I said it before and I'll say it again: EGG MAKES EVERYTHING BETTER! To my surprise, the burger was perfectly cooked, medium, juice blasting and flavorful just the way I like it, bacon was well executed, crispy yet still have some chewiness to it but the EGG was money, it is the binder of it all, what a beautiful sight to watch as the yolk slowly infuses the burger with it's juicy, creamy goodness. Your first bite was WOA, flavor texture overload! You got the juicy burger, crunch from bacon, coolness from the lettuce and tomato and finish it off with the creaminess of the yolk... DANG EXCELLENT and DELICIOUS!! MUST TRY!! Chili Chili Cheeseburger-  If you don't the mess and are into super big flavor then you can't go wrong with the Chili Chili Cheeseburger.  Cheeseburger with double chili on top, yes it's going to be messy but dang it's so flavorful, kinda makes you question how much beef do you need in a cheeseburger but whatever! You have the cheeseburger, topped with Chili- not too salty, got a good kick in the end with bits and pieces of raw onion plus the chipotle sauce.  What more do you want on your burger? DEFINITELY MUST TRY! Service: Decent service, the bottomless fries came out pretty slow and at the end, we were only able to get about 2 rounds of fries but our server was friendly and on top of things! Price: Average: Most gourmet burgers will run you around $10- $12 dollar plus drink you are looking at around $15 for a complete meal but it's pretty good consider their burgers definitely hit the spot and you might even get two meal out of it (remember bottomless fries). Overall: I had a much better experience at Red Robin this time around, the food was fresh and delicious, service was good and price was reasonable.  They definitely upped their game since the last time I was here and if you haven't been to Red Robin for a while, now it's a good time to give it another shot!

My friend and I had been wanting to go here for awhile now. The interior was bright and clean. Seemed well organized behind the bar. My friend had a tavern burger, but the larger one. I had the Ghost Pepper burger and added an egg. They were average. I've also had the Ghost Pepper burger at Quakersteak and while I like Quakersteak's food better, I liked the Ghost Pepper burger better at Red Robin because it was spicier. We also had Nachos. They were alright, but not worth the $9 price tag. The burgers were too small for the price. A few weeks ago they had a deal where it was two burgers (limited to certain burgers) and a small appetizer for $15. Upgrade to a full appetizer for like $2 more or something. That would have been a good deal. They have bottomless fries, but the amount they give you per serving is too small. You're done in a few minutes and need to ask for more, only the waitress is nowhere around. Service was poor. The waitress did not ask if we needed any drink refills. There's a tablet computer on the table which we could order from, call the waitress and pay our bill. When we first sat down the waitress said "Oh you can order Nachos in the tablet" and she went ahead and did it for us, but the rest of the tablet was not explained to us. We didn't realize we could call the waitress. We would have left sooner, but we were sitting around waiting for our check. We also didn't know that we need to request a check through the tablet. Maybe if the burgers were better and lower priced I could overlook the service, but I definitely won't be back here.

Ok I had Jason as a server. If you go here ask for him. Best service ever. My food came out very quick and it was hot and enjoyable. I got the fish and chips but substituted for sweet potato dries. Yes I know odd combo but love those fries over the steak fries. But you have to get the campfire sauce to dip. Yum.  It was lunch time and mind you you would think it would be crazy and it was not. Sat me right aways tables were clean. Manager also came to see how everything was which was very nice. If you don't know they have a rewards card you can sign up for and you get emails sent to you. By far this is the closest red Robins to me but would drive to any one with the service and hospitality that they offered here.
I went there with the wife. The Burgers were great as well as there wings. Service was fast and friendly. My only complaint is I was too full to eat more of the all you can eat fries.

What can I say... Same old Red Robin, food is okay but the wait staff is excruciatingly slow ... Place is maybe 1/8 full and I waited 20 mins for a refill on a beer, while seated next to an empty bar!!!' We used to come here, stopped for the slow service back then ...food isn't good enough to stand on its own......

Slowest service ever! Only people waiting to be seated and it took 10 minutes. They another 10 minutes to be treated and drink orders placed. Part of the food was cold when served but couldn't tell the waitress because she never came back to the table!

Ok! Sometimes you write a review and you feel "ummm... " when you reread it after a long time and then think of updating it.  Actually, now that I have moved to Boston I miss Red Robin's burger badly. 1 star is deducted just because of the service, as the burger arrived after a looooonnng wait. But, I never had a yummier burger anywhere else.  I still remember that it was so good and the best part is bottomless fries.

Their veggie burger is the best I've had ever!!! I've converted many beef lovers into red robin veggie burger lovers!!  Their seasoning is addictive too. I've bought two bottles of it. One for work and one for home. Their Mac-n-cheese...YUM!!! One thing I don't care for is the freckled lemonade. It taste great, but the defrosted frozen strawberries are not visually appealing, and I am someone who definitely eats with my eyes!

I'll bump up the stars for the customer service I received afterwards from Red Robin and the general manager Guy of this particular location. A Red Robin rep contacted me through Yelp and by email and I spoke to Guy by phone and explained what happened during that visit. He was very apologetic (not really his fault) and explained that it wasn't the kind of service they endorse and that I should have received. He emphasized that he'll make sure to let the employee know of this experience and to give them another try and to get in touch with him if/when we come back. I grew up in Piscataway so I'm very familiar with the area and I think I will give them another try next time I'm around the area.

Recently went here with my girlfriend and her 19 month old daughter they renovated the inside looks very nice now only thing is they took the games to occupy little kids away while they're waiting to be seated. Food is always good service is always quick never had a bad experience eating here

Cold soup that should have been hot, mac and cheese was plain pasta melted cheese on top that had turned cold by the time it was served.  Not busy, no excuse for expensive mess ups like this.   Fries were good though.

I love Red Robin.  I would go there repeatedly..then maybe I could gain some much needed weight. I got a freckled lemonade..the strawberries are awesome..I should try to ask for a cup full of strawberries.  I also tried the Jim Bean burger.  It was okay.  A little bit bland (and I am usually not one to complain about something being too bland, but if I'm paying ~$10 for a burger, it better excite my taste buds).  Live and learn. However, I gave this place 5 stars bc I would still go back..repeatedly.  Unlimited fries is great.  Service was generally quite responsive.   Overall, good experience.  Went hungry, left nauseatingly full.

Great place, fun atmosphere for a chain restaurant. For some reason I keep getting Jason as my server, but that's okay.  He is great, ....quiet, but fast and spot on with what you order and offers some great suggestions for dipping sauces and substitutions. I get the whiskey river chicken wrap and it is great!  Enjoy!!

Unless I am hallucinating I remember going to Red Robin 20+ years ago in Southern California. (Hallucinating or not I have no memory of what the place was like then) Seeing the chain popping up in various places on the East Coast was a chance to try it again. The tower of onion rings is very good and my standard meal has been the grilled salmon burger with a side salad instead of fries. The kids love the place and I have always been happy with the food I received. The service is always fast and friendly and for a burger joint I give them the thumbs up.
Service was forgetful, fries cold. Wrong drinks. Bathroom atrocious. Tried to look beyond and enjoy dinner. Burger ice cold in middle. I am a big Red Robin fan....sorry, not tonight. Yikes.

This is one of my favorite chain restaurants.  It's reasonably priced and the food is always delicious.  It's casual and fun to go with friends or family.  I've had tons of different items here - for starters, the towering onion rings are great.  They are crispy and pretty perfect and come with dipping sauces.  They're fun to get with a group.  I've also had the quesadilla - it's very good, and I like how it's chock full of cheese, bacon, tomatoes, and mushrooms.  The salsa is also pretty good. The Clucks and Fries are a good option - the chicken is crispy and tasty, and you can't beat their fries.  They are the best!!  Also, the Crispy Chicken Tender Salad is a very filling and delicious salad.  It comes with a ton of chicken.  Try the Bottomless Freckled Lemonade!  It's the best -- refreshing and sweet!

Great Burgers. I enjoy a lot of their food here. There salads are nice and large will be able to fill you up for sure.  I've had the Brushetta chicken sandwich a few times and it's delicious. One of my favorites!!  The steak fries are eh. I like them well done if not they are big pieces of mushy potato. Their sweet potato fries are on point!!

Our first and last visit was a hot mess.  The staff seemed non existent.  They had to find the cook.  They had to find a bartender, then didnt have the proper ingredients for my wife's cocktail.  My chicken burger was dry and tasteless.  And it wasn't cheap.  Who needs this?  People want to have a successful business then put in zero effort. Bye, bye birdie.

Somehow this restaurant is not nearly as good as other Red Robins I've eaten at. They do have the rewards system at this location though. The burgers and fries are okay. Service is good. Decorations are good like other Red Robins.

Love the burgers here.  I am a vegetarian, and it's very tough to come by a good burger.  I heard raving reviews about the place, so had to try it.  Oh boy was it worth it.  Frankly, I don't think I have ever had such a good meatless burger before.  Sadly, our service was mediocre, the server only came back once to check up on us, and the drink refill took forever.  But I am giving them a benefit of the doubt and hoping my next visit will square my concerns away.

Red Robin..YYYYUUUUUKKKK. went there for lunch this afternoon with my wife and new born. We never get to enjoy our meals together usually but he slept through the whole meal. The down side is it was horrible. I'm pretty sure the server forgot to put our order in. Two med burgers 25 minutes at lunch??? I don't think so. The she served us probably the smallest worst tasting sandwich ever. The burger was cold and non existent and tasteless all i could taste was the lettuce. The manager must have see my dismay and came and talked to us. I told him it was the worst burger ever. He assured me they could do better and give them another try. He said they were having a bad day. Really I couldn't even get the taste out of my mouth and I left hungry and disappointed..

Red Robin is a burger restaurant chain. Casual; a few tvs around. Well maintained and cleaned. Servers are friendly enough. Menu is mostly burgers (beef, chicken, and a few veggie options). A smattering of pastas, salads, and grilled dishes round it out but...I wouldn't - it's a self processed burger joint and a chain, anything you order that isn't a burger was probably frozen or came out of a can. All of their burgers/wraps come in just below 10$ and come with unlimited fries. They're not mindblowing or anything, but they are good and there are a ton of options for toppings.  Milkshakes, lemonade (free refills on that one), and a bevy of alcoholic beverages fill out the drink portion of the menu. Overall not a bad choice for a casual lunch or dinner, especially for a group that includes a few children (burgers and fries, what else is more pleasing for most kids?).

Let's start with the bad - My party of six was on a tight time frame because of a movie we were going to see after dinner.  We were all arriving in different vehicles since we were coming from work.  The first person that arrived went in to get a table for us, as some three of the others were pulling into the parking lot.  She was told that no one could be seated until the entire group arrived.  I can see doing this when you are packed, but the place was practically empty, and four of the six has already arrived.  We were so put off by this that we wanted to leave, but with the tight time frame, and the fact that she finally agreed to seat the four of us, we decided to stay.  Managers, please tell your hostess that this is ridiculous and just a bad business practice!  Not only were we put-off and may have gone to one of the several other restaurants nearby, you also could have missed out on money from the round of drinks ordered while we were waiting for the rest of our party to arrive.  Now for the good - The waitress was friendly, attentive, and made sure that we got to our movie on time, which more than made up for the rudeness of the hostess.  She came to the table multiple times to take orders for the two that arrived later, and to make sure we had enough drinks and fries.  The food was hot and tasty, and came out fast.  No mistakes were made by the waitress or the kitchen, and we were all happy with our meal, plus the pricing is very reasonable.

The 1 star is not for the franchise. It is for this location. Only once in my life have I sat at a restaurant, and then got up and left before placing an order. And it was at this Red Robin. Why?  My family walked in the front door and there was no hostess. We waited, someone asked if we were being helped, after I said no he said ok let me get someone. Another 5 minutes goes by. Are you being helped. No. Ok let me get someone. a few minutes later someone finally showed up, walked us to the back and sat us. On that walk there was a table of 3 waiters/waitresses sitting and playing on their phones. After looking at the menu putting them down and waiting 10 minutes no one had come over, no water nothing! AND IT WAS EMPTY INSIDE (now I know why). We got up, left and went across the street to Fridays, where someone opened the door for us. Sat us immediately and our server was over in seconds to introduce herself and get waters.  Most of my reviews are about service. And my Star ratings reflect mostly the service as well. The food is important, but not as important as an enjoyable experience. I can make a burger at home for $3

I love this place. I don't come here often enough but their steak fries w/ honey mustard and seasoning salt rock. I always get the guacamole bacon burger which is always great. Also a fan of the milkshakes which I don't always get when I'm there but they are generous and thick and tasty. The drinks are strong if you sit at the bar. Overall a great place for a fun dinner date or to hang out with friends.

Ugh horrible.  I got the guacamole/bacon burger. The bun was dry and maybe stale. The burger was overcooked. It was not impressive.  My mom asked me what I thought. This is what I said: "Mom, please stop taking me to burger places in Jersey. I live in NY, home of some of the best burger joints in this country. Just. . . don't." And then she proceeded to smack me upside the head for being a smart ass.  So thanks a lot Red Robin. You gave me a crappy burger and a bump on the head.

Good food! Terrible service! It's like Target vs. Walmart. You can't come here for customer service. Went for my bday burger. Supppppper yummy but got it wrong. Every time we come here the service either takes 30 min or more or they just downright mess it up. Go for the yummy food but don't expect to get the service. Epic fail for a good burger joint!

Food is ok. Just a lot of different varieties of burgers. The service is horrible. Our server, Anjelica, was rude from start to finish. She did not bring our drink.  She did not bring french fries. She did not check on us when we needed refill.  We had to flag her and even then she did not come for another 5 minutes. She brought a refill when we finished our meal. I will never come here again because of her.

Went here during strike training at VZ and i have to say that the food was surprisingly good. A burger which was nice sized was excellent and it was good.   The BEST part of this was that they had REFILLS on fries! What a novel concept and it worked well.  Extra star for refilling my fries with hot fries!

The service at this Red Robin, just like every other Red Robin is pretty fucking awful. HOWEVER, the food is always so good it keeps me coming back at least once a month... but for real, the service is really bad BUT THOSE BURGERS YUMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMM..... the red royalty card is badass too, I'm a unhealthy idiot so I've collected many free burgers from it

I'm American. I love burgers.  Red Robin has a pretty large menu of burgers, but none of them jumped out at me last time I was there. The one I got was still big and good though so I won't complain. Couple that with unlimited fries and I'm a happy girl. The service was really bad though, both the hostess and waiter. We stood at the desk while the hostess wrote a freakin novel in her little book. After a few minutes I asked if we would get seated. She apologized but went back to her book for another couple minutes. The waiter was slow and unattentive.  Horrible service but I love burgers so I'll be back.
Yummmmm!!!! The guacamole bacon burger on ciabatta, freckled lemonade, and onion rings! The server was very attentive as well.

Service was great. Beer tastes watered down and my medium rare Burger came out very well done. I didn't even bother sending it back because I felt that it would have came out the same. I do feel the meal would have been much better if the product was coined the way the customer requested. I will give this chain another shot before I give up hope all together.

The Red Robin has been one of our family favorite places to eat, the burgers are big and the fries are endless..... Most of the Red Robin these days offer a gluten free selection as well, Delta make sure that the fries are gluten free too, as they fry them in a separate frier. What better than a nice cold beer and a handful of burger. Tried the sweet potato fries it's really good....: )

Took the family for cheap night out.  Have been to this location several times.  Service was a bit weird, as we were told our server would not be over for 5 minutes.  Also asked for a table and this caused a big commotion.  We could clearly see that a bunch of tables were open. Food was average and not as good as it once was.  They bring the food out right after they bring the appy which is an issue.  I really hate that. It is what you expect it to be
Good burger and quick service.

I love this place. I have to say this burger place is better than the one in woodbridge mall. The burgers feel bigger and don't even come burnt. The woodbridge locations always serve the burgers burnt and the size of the patty seems smaller. The waitresses at both of these locations were equally nice and attentive but this particular location made me feel at ease.

Our waitress was absolutely wonderful and on top of everything.  I hated to see her work her tail off while other employees sat there on the coolers behind the bar. Food was terrible and I've seen clean bathrooms in port-o-johns after a day 3 Day concert.  First and last time. Disgusting staff and restaurant. The waitress we had should run far away from that place

Man, I went in starving, and came out wishing I could surgically remove my stomach because I was so full. Had the Tavern with the tropical sunburn style. It was good, until the spiciness from the jalepenoes starting stacking up and burning my mouth. They destroyed my taste buds, so prepare yourself if you order the tropical sunburn style. Fries as always, are awesome with the different dipping sauces (ranch, thousand island, and honey mustard) and the red robin's seasoning. I also had the mint brownie smoothie, which was all right: the typical smoothie. Service: the waitress we had was really proactive. She would give us refills of the bottomless drinks and fries when we didn't even ask. When we asked for honey mustard and ranch sauce, she gave us all three flavors :)

The service here has declined over the years to where it now takes over an hour to get your food.... The bread was stale and my kids ended up waiting for there drinks for over 20 minutes... I passed 2 other red robins to come to this one alone with countless other restaurants along the way.... Not worth my time to come here any more

Did you know that a Root Beer Float is only 25 cents more than a regular soda....and has free refills!!!! I'll bet you didn't. We always start with the onion ring tower and it's really good. I love both sauces they offer with the rings. I try to save a ring or 2 to throw on my burger.mmmmm My girlfriend loves the veggie burger here so we come often enough. I've had most of the burgers and they are cooked well. The only burger I did not enjoy was the one with pineapple and teriyaki sauce. Although I love both these things the burger was too sweet. Next to try is the Royal Robin Burger with a fried egg on top! I order my burger Med. Rare and it always comes out juicy. I don't destroy my fries so I usually do not get a refill although they are glad to keep the bottomless fries coming.  On weekends there is always a wait of about half hour.  Also I've had the fish and chips several times and it is plenty of food.  I do like spicy food so when I saw the addition of a limited time extra spicy menu I rushed in. Previously I have had the Burnin' Love burger but that didn't kick as much as I would have liked. The limited menu had "Ghost Chili Ketchup" and some other supposedly spicy sauces. I know I ordered the burger that sounded hottest and asked for the addition of any other specialty limited sauces on the side but nothing really hit the heat I was looking for. Either way they get points for effort.

I have been to this location twice I waited for my second visit to write a review bc I wanted to to see if the service was just a bad day but I had the exact same experience the second time around first it took more then 10 min for a Waiter to come over to us second it took 20 min for our apps to come out and 3 min into eating the apps our dinner came out the Waiter barely came to our table but went to another table ALOT my order was wrong I had ordered onion rings instead of fries so I said something I finished my burger my app and my drink before my onion rings came out for dessert I ordered the doe tower witch she said came with a chocolate sauce and blueberries sauce it actually came with TWO chocolate sauces one container had about a spit worth of sauce in it I was there for 2 in a half hours on a Monday night with maybe 10 tables sat the food is always OK not bad l. The only difference I had this time then I did last time is both my wife and I got food poisoning the next day going to the bathroom all night and day and throwing up this is the last time I'm going there

Burger was decent, service was a little slow, they apparently run a skeleton crew at night. Watch out how they cool your meat, I order well-done and it came out medium. Hate to think what rare looks like, they probably lead a cow out to you on a rope and hand you a knife! Overall okay, but nothing to write home about. Are there any decent restaurants in this town?

Aft all the reviews and always passing by this place for years and never tried it, have to say it was a little weird at first. Arrived on a Sunday evening at 6:30 and the place was fairly empty and we waited a good ten- fifteen minutes to be seated.( again muliti- tasking needed here)  Ok well family of five finally got our seat and we look through the menu and all picked out what they wanted. Everybody was happy with the burgers and the most important one my daughter was happy with her burger and pickles so that was a good thing so far. As for my burger I had the pub brawler with make me cry and it was great and the service was slow at the beginning but was ok after the burgers came out and no one was complaining. Yeah I'm a fan will be back again!

We went to Red Robin because a vegan friend had highly recommended their veggie burger (Boca burger).  It did not disappoint, and i did enjoy it, but it seemed a tad pricey for a veggie burger (bill just for that came to a little over $10).  I would likely return but only on a special occasion vs an ordinary day.

I LOVE RED ROBIN. I don't care that it is a chain; it is delicious. It is one thing that I really wish New York City had, so I wouldn't have to wait to go home to New Jersey just to have it again. When I was in college and visited my friends at Rutgers, we would always go to Red Robin. It would instantly put me in a good mood. I'm getting excited just writing this review.  In addition to a burger, you must always get a freckled lemonade and garlic parm fries. They are both BOTTOMLESS. The freckled lemonade comes with strawberries in it, and it is the perfect combo of sweet and tangy. The garlic parm fries are big steak fries stuffed with potatoes and topped with shredded parmesan and drizzled with garlicky goodness. I came here with my best friend for the first time several years ago. We both wanted freckled lemonade but figured that we would share one since it was bottomless. The waiter was so nice and just brought us out two freckled lemonades but only charged us for one, which was so thoughtful and actually makes a lot of sense. This would prevent him from having to refill our glasses more often. We tried to do this in future visits, but the waiters refused and were actually confused. If only we had that waiter that first time ... My favorite burger is the whiskey river bbq burger: whiskey river bbq sauce, cheddar cheese, cripsy onion straws, lettuce, and mayo. It is always cooked to perfection and is oozing with flavor. The crispy onion straws give it texture, and the the barbecue sauce just adds the icing to the cake. It is a safe choice for a yummy meal. I have a tried a few of the others as well: - the sauteed shroom burger (sauteed mushrooms, garlic parmesan butter, melted swiss): pretty standard burger. No complaints here. - A.1. peppercorn burger (applewood smoked bacon, melted pepper-jack cheese, A.1. peppercorn spread, crispy onion straws on an onion bun): very flavorful. I was surprised how tasty this actually was. - royal red robin burger (applewood smoked bacon, american cheese, lettuce, mayo, and a fried egg): surprisingly disappointing considering it features the name of the restaurant, so it should be a classic burger that everyone would enjoy. I love fried eggs and adding them to sandwiches, but this burger actually tasted like something you could get at any boring burger joint. I was not impressed at all. I often see other tables order the towering onion rings and long to order it as well, but I know it would be way too much food. I want to try everything on the menu because it looks and sounds so good (whoever does the photography for their menus does an excellent job because the pictures of the food all make me salivate), but I need to have my burger, fries, and freckled lemonade every time. The only complaint I have is that when it is busy (which is often), the service can be somewhat slow. I always leave here with food coma, but at least my tummy is super satisfied. Prices are reasonable, and that's why I come here time and time again. I cannot use enough superlatives to describe Red Robin.

Wow, I'm surprised at the reviews on service. My husband and I came today for lunch. We started out with the boneless wings appetizer with the banzai sauce. This was a great deal as it was only $5, and came with homemade chips as well! My husband tried a new burger on the menu, the southern charm with bottomless fries. I ordered the tavern double with bottomless fries. His was very good and I recommend the tavern double because it's smaller but filling and only $6.99 with the fries. Our server was very nice and attentive and we were visited twice by the host and manager if we needed more fries, drinks, etc. Red robin also has a rewards system so make sure to sign up.

Imo, it's a decent burger place if it's fast food and no waitresses.  Because it's a sit down place, I thought the price were a bit high for just better dressed Johnny Rocket burgers.  A lot of burgers are just too much addons and not much flavor in the patty. As a purist I prefer a nice medium-well patty slightly pink, smoke flavored, and a nice burger sauce.  Toasted buns.  Their patty was just ok, very greasy not juicy enough because they cook them well done. Bobby Flay's burgers are much better, even though Red Robins got these giant onions rings they taste more like a fried dough than Bobby Flay's crispy beer battered rings. Waitresses and servers are good and very friendly.

My family and I went here for dinner last night & had a great time. I got the Smoke & Pepper burger with bottomless sweet potato fries which was fantastic. My boyfriend got the Burnin' Love burger which he really enjoyed, and my daughters each got hamburgers which they liked a lot. Our server was very friendly and attentive. The only thing that is stopping me from giving our experience 5 stars it that we received our tower of onions app not even 5 minutes before our burgers came out.

I had always seen commercials for Red Robin wondering where the heck they were (just as I used to do with Sonic, before they opened up all over and still what I do with Golden Coral)! Luckily I found out that there is one in South Plainfield not too far from my bf. He decided to take me there for my first time this past weekend.  Our waiter was super friendly and attentive. Everything on the menu looked delish, but we both decided to order burgers. And to my surprise I found out that the fries and select drinks were bottomless, every fast foodies dream!  For an appetizer, we ordered the RR's Buzzard Wings ($8.99) which came in a fiery Cayenne Pepper Sauce. This was mainly for my bf since I'm not a spicy food fan. I did manage to try one wing which was okay. My bf ordered the Prime Chophouse Burger  w/ Sweet Pot Fries ($8.79) and a Classic Chocolate Milkshake ($2.99). The Sweet Pot Fries came with a dipping sauce which seemed to be a mix of Ketchup and the Thai spicy sauce, Srisacha. Even though their menu had a wide array of unique burgers to choose from I decided to order their Red Robin Gourmet Cheeseburger w/ Regular Steak Fries ($9.49) and a Freckled Lemonade ($3.99) (bottomless). Yes boring, but I always like to try the most basic thing on a menu during my first time at a place. Food came out quick and our burgers were cooked perfectly to how we wanted (Medium). The fries were crispy and delicious! The Choc Milkshake was rich and sweet! The Freckled Lemonade was a blend of sweet and tangy, which I loved!  I'll be asking my bf to take me here again, which I'll then try one of their more unique gourmet burgers!
Came here for a milkshake at approximately 9 PM, to be told they had run completely run out of milkshake mix. Plus the waiter was very rude. Will not come back / 10

Red Robin has the best fries and the best dips for its fries as well. Make sure you try to get every dip you can get out of your waiters when you go. I also ordered the Royal Red Robin, which has to be one of the top 10 burgers in the country. They are very accommodating as well. It seems as though every time we are trying to plan a surprise birthday dinner for my friends, we always choose Red Robin.

I have been to couple of places that serve burgers but, I loved red robin. They have some very delicious and juicy burgers. I had the fiery ghost burger which is a very spicy burger ( try at your own risk ) since i love spicy stuff, onion rings and a raspberry milkshake with that. Yummy !!!

Red Robin is a favorite among my friends.  It's more than just a burger joint- they always have new items such as fried jalapeno coins (delicious!) and balsamic cream sauce.  I've enjoyed their burgers, onion rings and chicken sandwiches.  The last time I went, it took a long time to get our food even though it was on the emptier side, but our waitress was very attentive and friendly.  I still want to try their newest milkshakes and list of fun cocktails.  I'll continue to go back!

Went to Red Robin for lunch on a Saturday afternoon.  It was busy, but not completely full.  We were seated quickly and the service was good. I had the peppercorn burger and it was very good.  My wife had the Wiskey burger and she had no complaints.   Overall, solid burgers and fries. Good service.  Haven't had a bad experience in the 4 times I ate there.

Unlimited fries is a dangerous thing. My boyfriend's got a real love affair with Red Robin restaurants that started long before I ever met him.  When he found out there was one within 15 minutes of us, we headed there right away.  The restaurant is usually crowded for dinner, especially when you go on a weekend.  This past Friday we were seated at a table that shared a wall with the bar, sandwiched between two large tables with kids--one of which had calm, behaving kids, and the other had screamers who darted between the table and the small video arcade at the front of the restaurant. In addition to this noise, the bar's ice-crushing margarita machine was right behind my head, giving me a headache and making it impossible to have a conversation. This is definitely not the place for a conventional date night. But I really can't complain for the tasty, relatively cheap burgers you get here.  There's such a variety that I'm sure you'll find something to fit your taste.  I like the Bleu Ribbon Burger, which has steak sauce and bleu cheese crumbles, and my boyfriend satisfied his RR craving with a Banzai Burger, which has pineapple slices and teriyaki sauce.  There are other options besides burgers, but just like you don't go to a seafood restaurant and order the chicken, you don't come to Red Robin for their salads.  Each burger comes with unlimited French fries, seasoned with their spicy "Cajun" seasoning.  We each got two orders of fries and felt like they had to roll us out of the restaurant, Violet Beauregard-style.  BF's a fan of their onion ring tower with the three different dipping sauces, and it's fun and kitschy, but I don't think their onion rings are anything to write home about, and if I'm getting another deep-fried side dish for free (the unlimited fries), I don't see ordering something extra as well. This place only gets a star off because of the noise level (which is understandable since it's a family restaurant, but I couldn't even hear myself think).  Red Robin definitely satisfies burger cravings but good.

We love this guilty pleasure. In addition to their array of signature burgers, the fries (topped with southern seasoning salt) are fresh and delicious. Milkshakes must contain 1,000 calories each, but they are out of this world. On occasion the "bottomless fries" take eons to arrive but we've figured out that ordering a second serving as soon as dinner arrives is the way to keep hot fries coming.
HMMMM yummy...Guinness Irish beer shake....and burger was great as well. will go again
I usually like red robbins... Great salads... Until I ate at this one. Very poor dinner.  Skip this place if possible, but dont skip other Red Robins.

Have been to this location twice now. Keeping well in mind that it is a chain restaurant, I have to say that the food here is pretty decent. The burgers are good, and the french fries are seasoned well. My only issue came during my second visit here, when I ordered a well-done burger and it still came out pink in the middle. I happen to be one of the few people who like really well-done burgers. However, the server took care of it immediately with no issues. Overall, I would return. It's not necessarily a gourmet experience, but it's enjoyable. (It can get admittedly loud in there, though.)

Visited this place two times.   Both times they forgot to bring my appetizers and drinks, it finally came while I was halfway thru my entree. Server was friendly, although painfully slow and inattentive.   Never got any utensils and condiments.  I had to take them from other tables. I ordered the wings and chips appetizer, honey bourbon lemonade, and the burning love burger. The wings were very dry and cold - I'm assuming because they forgot about it. Chips were soaked and soggy - Same reason as above probably The burning love burger was not good or bad, it was just OK Honey bourbon lemonade was very good, as long as you like bourbon (It has a very strong bourbon taste instead of lemonade)

While I consider myself a very loyal customer to the Red Robin chains (I'm a Red Royalty member & eat there about 3x a month), I had one of the most awful dining experiences today.  Like every visit, I ordered a Banzai Burger and noticed my burger patty tasted differently.  I even had my boyfriend, who is a Nutritionist, look at the meat and he identified that the meat was fatty and the quality of the patty was not a fine cut (bad).  When explained this to Nia, our waitress, a manager named Kim came to our table to address the issue, but provided very poor customer service.  I asked her if they used different patties today, explaining to her that it tasted off and was unhappy with my less-than-half eaten meal.  Kim merely said nothing was cooked differently and told us the only thing she could do was re-cook the burger.  At that point, I lost my appetite and politely declined.  Kim replied with "Sorry you don't like it," then walked away.  I was not offered anything else to eat in its place and felt as if my concerns were neglected.  I have worked in food management for 3 years and my boyfriend owns a restaurant in NY so we are fully aware of how guests should be treated.  After a very upsetting meal, Nia forgot to give us the shake we ordered, but I felt it wasn't worth my time and wanted to leave.  We were given a full priced check and were even charged for dipping sauces that I have never been charged for before.  On our way out, I saw the manager, Kim, seating guests.  I feel if your managers paid more attention to customer needs, and not playing hostess, you would have a lot happier guests.

Very good burgers for a chain.  I enjoy the different varieties.  I have only eaten burgers here on my numerous visits though I often think to try something different I remember how good my last burger was and have a burger. The onion rings are also great, not greasy, whole onions.  If you are near one, give it a try, you will not be disappointed.

Full of flavor burgers...especially the 'ghost pepper' version....onion rings, fries and beer...life is good... they have a decent kid friendly menu too....a nice place for fun dinners and get-together...
Not a bad place at all, it remind me of diner, but an upscale diner that serves booze. I had the A-1 burger definitely a good tasting burger with BOTTOMLESS fries.

Gourmet Burgers...yeah. Haven' been to this place in a while but the burger are the star of the show here. Every burger comes with bottomless fries but they are kind of bland and unremarkable so I've never ordered more and they are the thick steak fries that I've never been a fan of. they just scream "Eat as much as you can we are just filler". Anyway back to the main stage, there are a lot of different kinds of burgers from burgers with an egg on top to the Pot Roast burger my favorite being the guacamole bacon burger. They also have veggie options if you are a person who doesn't like the taste of seared flesh.
It's ok. Just like your regular chain of food.

Just joined yelp but have been to the SP RR probably three dozen times since it opened in 2006.  The turnover is unbelievable, I rarely even see the same server twice.  The burgers are creative and really tasty, that's the most important thing to know.  Beyond that, most of the nits I could share I just write to  , I don't really want to discourage you from trying this place just because  each of the last 3 times there I waited a rather long time to get a drink refill.   It is in the survey you take "did the server refill the drink without you having to ask." I am really not one to make a scene or call for the manager so instead I share on websites.  Have not really tried their happy hour and just joined their loyalty program, which may soon be offering a key ring swipe card instead of a full thick credit sized card.

Horrible. Ordered a burger no cheese no mayo. Burger comes out with mayo. I send it back and they flip the same burger so the mayo is hidden and give it back to me. Red Robin is dead to me now. Wish there was a zero star option.

One of my favorite chain burger places...the guacamole burger is heaven and fries are always good. Freckled lemonade yummm w bottomless refills score. Just don't go home and look up calorie content lol

Step aside Five Guys: we have a new winner in town. Unlike many inexpensive burger joints, Red Robin doesn't assume you want your burger well-done: they are perfectly happy cooking their burgers medium or medium-rare. The burger itself is juicy, delicious, and conveniently wrapped in paper to make it easy to hold. Served on the side is a bottomless basket of crispy steak fries that are perfect after some light seasoning. While the waitstaff is relatively young, I have never had a problem. Even when busy, service is quick and the waiters and waitresses keep the drinks topped off and the baskets of fries full. P.S. Be sure to try the root beer float. It is delicious and a great value considering that refills are free.

My introduction to Red Robin came in Southern California and I was very pleasantly surprised. I used to have abhorrence for all things chain restaurant but Red Robin provided a delectable meal and that's the truth. I became hooked on the Bleu Cheese burger, the perfect combination of succulent charbroiled meat and zesty cheese. Oh my God, don't get me started - it was that good. So we checked out this Red Robin on impulse. My spouse had the Prime Chophouse and wasn't as into it as I expected, said mine was better (of course, I ordered the Bleu again). The fries are good and crispy and you can't lose with them being bottomless. I thought $2.99 was too expensive for a small kid's milkshake (and it was quite small) but aside from that, I think their menu prices are fair. The problem is this particular Red Robin really fell short in the service department. We stood around waiting for a table for almost 15 minutes while the majority of the place was empty, literally empty tables all around. Also, we requested a booth and were told we could not have one because that waitress would be leaving soon. What difference does it make? The booth we wanted was literally 10 feet away from where we wound up sitting. Go figure. Then it took a very long while to take our orders and then an even longer while to get our food. Once the food arrived, we realized we had not been given any napkins or silverware (we had ordered sides of cole slaw, etc. so we needed forks). We sat there unnoticed until I got up to speak to someone who happened by (she didn't look too happy either). I asked for water and the waitress brought me just that - one water. Seemed to me that she should have just brought waters for the three of us, but ok, fine. Our waitress was a young, blonde girl and it didn't seem like she was new. Then when we asked for additional sodas (right after we ordered dessert for everyone), she brought us new sodas but left the old empty glasses sitting there crowding up the table. This just seemed very unprofessional to me. I got fed up and grabbed the dirty glasses and just stuck them on a nearby table. Whatever. I could understand if the place was packed but it wasn't. So I'm giving this Red Robin experience two stars even though I love their food. The service was so poor it came very close to ruining the meal even with that incredible chocolate cake with the vanilla icecream and strawberry syrup and that's saying a lot.

I love the onion ring tower and the never ending strawberry lemonade! Being a vegetarian this was all I could really eat from this place.  It has a great atmosphere and the service was fast and friendly. Great place to get some apps and hang out with friends or even bring a family for dinner.

I really like Red Robin's menu and usually enjoy dining there, however my last couple of visits to THIS location were VERY DISAPPOINTING.  The service was POOR!!  The server forgot my appetizer and the food took over 30 minutes to come out of the kitchen.  The server didn't explain the reason for the delay until AFTER the food came out (by that time, who cares?) and the manager told me he would email me some form of comp meal to make up for my inconvenience...it never arrived in my email.

Love Red Robin. The burgers are excellent. They are always prompt with their service and drink refills. Love the choice of toppings and buns so you can customize your burger. Their chicken is also great. It is definitely a favorite restaurant of ours and we are going tomorrow!

I was surprised to see a Red Robin in NJ...just happened upon this one and thought I'd give it a try. While the help, was all very nice, the food was awful. Burgers were tasteless, and the fries soggy and LOADED with salt. Salad was decent, but small. Won't try this one again.

Meh, it's an ok place.  It's another one of those themed restaurants, this one specializing in burgers.  It's a little more expensive than it should be, but I guess you're paying the wages for the actor who walks around dressed like the robin too.

The burgers here are definitely very good. It's a chain restaurant and they don't try to hide it. Service is ok.  They offer bottomless steak fries with all fo their sandiwiches which I have defiantley taken advantage of.  Plenty of seating at the inside table or at the bar and if it's nicer out take advantage of the outdoor seating although it is very limited.  My biggest problem is the food is just terrible for you. Now don't get me wrong I know that a burger joint isn't going to be healthy, but if you look at there nutritional info its just downright awful.  I mean some of the burgers have your full days worth of calories and sodium in it.  But if your looking to eat healthy your probaly not at Red Robin.
